Phrenic nerve

Phrenic nerve arises from C3,4,5 (keeps the diaphragm alive) and passes down over scalenus anterior (see C6 slice ) before passing in front of the subclavian artery and behind the subclavian vein to enter the thorax. It descends in the mediastinum, just medial to the pleura. On the right it runs lateral to the great veins. On the left, it passes just lateral to the left ventricle. The phrenic nerve is the only innervation of the diaphragm .
